file_content.text: The ship will sink, and its darkness will be snuffed out. Because of your help.
A ship. An ancient Sith starship. This was the Gormak's Evuk-Nosk?
Not just a relic, then. Worse. A working Sith vessel in the hands of the Gormak... catastrophic.
Voss-Ka could have been destroyed in days. The Gormak could even have gone offworld with this ship, and conquered. No wonder they searched so hard.
The ship was affecting Nodin-Fe's mind. Anyone who used it would have been in terrible danger.
It was tainted by darkness.
The marsh is the ship's proper place, yet I can't help wondering what stories it had to tell.
I wonder what its history is.
Hmm. We researched inscriptions of a Sith Lord who brought many weapons and droids to Voss. Might be his ship. Or even his tomb.
The Gormak have wasted a lot of troops and resources hunting for this thing. They'll be less dangerous for a while.
Now they're less of a threat.
An appropriate irony, correct?
Whenever something should stay buried, you can guarantee some idiot will turn up with a shovel.
It probably won't stay lost.
No. This terrible ship is dangerous, tainted by evil. It must be forgotten.
What's our next move?
Then this is over.
This terrible ship. Tainted, and dark. It must remain sunk forever.
But to keep this ship buried will take Republic aid. Hmm. Organization, people, resources. Could use military assistance.
You've done much. Could you do a little more? Take this message to Lieutenant Randa in Voss-Ka? We can't risk a transmission being intercepted.
I will, but don't forget the Voss. I'm sure they'd be happy to keep the ship away from the Gormak.
Maybe the Voss could help too.
Would be diplomatic. I'll invite them, see what they say.
Of course.
If I'm headed that way.
You saved so many. Voss and Republic civilians. And the Gormak, from falling to an ancient evil.
Thank you. May the Force be with you always.
Remember. Don't risk the marshes while those Gormak relays are still live.
Hmm. Organized. All heavily armed. Clearly more than simple reinforcements, therefore....
Hmm. A fellow of the order. Clearly powerful, perhaps even the one who slew Darth Angral. Therefore....
Hmm. A fellow of the order. Obviously capable, strongly resembles the current Barsen'thor. So....
Hmm. Republic uniform. Special Forces insignia; Havoc Squad. Never seen Special Forces here before. So....
Hmm. Hardly armed, shabbily dressed, yet managed to survive here despite hostile forces. Meaning....
Hmm. Well armed and equipped. Obviously didn't come here by chance. Therefore....
You've come to help with the Gormak, and this Evuk-Nosk they're looking for. Correct?
Master Halykus said you might need help.
You must be Padawan Qualie.
So he remains well. Good to know.
Yes, that's correct.
I think you've been around the Voss a little too long.
You're weird.
You are as you are. I simply observe.
Master Halykus sent me his notes on the Evuk-Nosk. Fascinating, just missing a conclusion.
Geological records and recent Gormak actions suggest the Evuk-Nosk once rested near the dam, but was carried away in the great flood. Carried here. Somewhere nearby.
Master Halykus mentioned a flood, but I'm not clear on the details.
Tell me about this flood.
This was Gormak territory. The flood came--origins uncertain. The Gormak left, the Evuk-Nosk was washed away. Eventually, the Voss built the dam.
You're sure it's here?
The Gormak believe so. All evidence points to it.
I feel like I've been chasing after this thing forever.
I'm sick of this search.
Then be happy. You're close.
A Voss in the camp, Nodin-Fe, talks of something lost in the marshes. It's hard to understand him.
But Nodin-Fe says what's lost is old, and dangerous. And the Gormak are in the marshes. The Evuk-Nosk--must be.
If the Gormak see me near their relic, they'll bring everything they have to stop me.
It'll be hard to get close.
Correct. The Gormak are using relays of some sort to coordinate. Need to handle those, first.
I wouldn't mind a chance to study this relic.
And it must be fascinating.
The Gormak aren't just going to hand this thing over for the asking, are they?
This might get messy.
No. Might even have trouble getting close.
Nodin-Fe, you said?
If it's not, I'll be angry.
If it's not, I'll be angry.
Time is not open to waste.
First, ensure the Gormak can't call for aid. They've been using communication relays of some kind; not my field.
Ask Ethen Wessiri and his assistant. Quite smart, rather single-minded. They'll help you with the relays. Then see what Nodin-Fe has to say.
Hello.
